items.content_html:
The lquote and rquote attributes are deprecated and the changes in 107 disable them by default. They can be enabled using

mathml.ms_lquote_rquote_attributes.disabled = false

Open question

Do we want to document the "legacy" (deprecated) behavior or just remove this example and keep the default case?

Parent task

  • #21635
items.title: relnote(107) lquote/rquote attributes are disabled by default

items.content_html:
Description

lower resolusion of sample image to 1200x800 (a reasonable @ 2x of embed frame size)
to avoid traffic-throttling by/of picsum.photos

Motivation

current size of 6858x4574 (https://picsum.photos/id/1080/6858/4574) is evidently became outside of bounds or just manually gutted from producing too much traffic.

Additional details

screenshot of https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#result

screenshot of https://picsum.photos/id/1080/6858/4574

output of https://picsum.photos/id/1080/1200/800

Related issues and pull requests

currently none, but if picsum.photos is used in other articles â€” those need to be re-checked
items.title: lower resolusion of sample image to avoid throttling

Additional details

items.content_html:
Description

Bug 1740608 has amended the way in which error information is reported from scripting.executeScript() â€“ the error property returned now represents the value the script throws or rejects with.
items.title: Error handling for scripting.executeScript()

items.content_html: I think stopping at "auto" is somewhat misleading; the first time I read this, I interpreted it as meaning that the percentage would simply result in the intrinsic size being used, when in fact the calculated resultant size of the grid is used with the percentage.
items.title: Added some explanation from the CSS spec for clarity

items.content_html:
Description

Updates the documentation for the action.openPopup API following changes across browsers, including the Firefox changes in https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D139796.

I've removed the note about user gesture requirements from the main body since this does not apply in any other browser (see https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xzuw1dMuf5Lub8UPME2zjxyp3nCKXk-3jtSY2kdI-FQ/edit?usp=sharing for Chrome) or Safari. Instead I've added it as a compatibility note in mdn/browser-compat-data#18202.

All browsers now also support a windowId parameter so I've added documentation for that.

Motivation

I've been working on this API recently and want to make sure the documentation is an up to date point of reference.

Additional details

  • Announcement in WebKit release notes: https://webkit.org/blog/12522/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-142/
  • Chrome proposal: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xzuw1dMuf5Lub8UPME2zjxyp3nCKXk-3jtSY2kdI-FQ/edit?usp=sharing
  • Firefox bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1755763

Related issues and pull requests

Depends on: mdn/browser-compat-data#18202
items.title: Document changes to action.openPopup API

items.content_html:
Description

Document Sec-CH-Prefers-Reduced-Motion and Sec-CH-Prefers-Color-Scheme headers.

Motivation

Sec-CH-Prefers-Color-Scheme header shipped in Chromium 93, Sec-CH-Prefers-Reduced-Motion will ship in Chromium 108.

Additional details

Here is web.dev post: https://web.dev/user-preference-media-features-headers/

Related issues and pull requests

BCD PR: TBD
items.title: Document two Sec-CH-* Client Hint headers

items.content_html:
Description

Add a section to the page on runtime.Port, regarding the lifecycle of a Port.
This addresses the facts that:

  • Ports can be disconnected in response to various events, and
  • these circumstances can differ between Firefox and Chrome.

Motivation

I discovered there can be subtle differences in the conditions under which a Port may become disconnected, in Firefox versus Chrome. Knowing this could save extension developers a lot of headache, and I didn't find any existing mention of it in the docs.

Additional details

  • Here is a demonstration of one surprising way in which Ports can become disconnected, when a single recipient unloads.
  • QUESTION: How much does the above demo generalize? In my test, the closing of an options page caused the disconnection. Is it true that the unloading of any single recipient is enough?
  • QUESTION: Is this actually intended behavior, or a bug? I.e. does Firefox really want its behavior on this matter to differ from that of Chrome? It would be great if a Firefox developer could weigh in.
  • I've written the new section as a stub. Ideally, it would be as complete as Chrome's corresponding section.
items.title: Add section on Port lifecycle

items.content_html:
Description

Alt tag description was added to presentation_mode_illustration.png on this page.

Motivation

Provides relevant information for readers when images do not load.

Additional details

Alt description: 1-UA mode loaded the Controlling and Presenting pages together before outputting to displays. 2-UA mode loaded them separately using the Presentation Control Protocol.

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to issue #21616
items.title: Alt tag added - reference issue #21616

items.content_html:
Extra information added to the Note about trailing slashes on void elements.

Description

Added information to the Note about trailing slashes on void elements, warning the reader that the W3C Validation Service will "flag" it as useless and potentially harmful.

Motivation

When I submitted code from this page, the W3C validator flagged it, and I at first thought it was a warning instead of just an informative flagging, and thought the "discrepancy" between this page's use of the slash and W3C's apparent warning against it should be cleared up a bit.

Additional details

I have no idea what I'm doing in this edit/submit/pull-request GitHub process, so if I'm doing it improperly, apologies for my ignorance.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update index.md

The ARIA guides section was a text-only list. After going back through the project history, I cannot find the associated links with the text. This PR adds a list of resources to get started on refreshing this.
